intro: Coussapoa acutifolia, commonly known as the sharp-leaved huito, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Coussapoa acutifolia is often found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests.
